episodes.shortSummary: How is Olaf and Fritha's triangular triumph faring in West Sussex?

episodes.summary: In 2017, Leigh and Richard bought a derelict Cornish flour mill to restore and turn into their home. By 2021, the rooms and landscaping were still unfinished. Has the grind finally paid off?

episodes.shortSummary: Duncan and Liz build a revolutionary Passivhaus Premium powerhouse of a home
episodes.summary: Duncan and Liz build a revolutionary Passivhaus Premium powerhouse of a home in the Cotswolds. But with a spiralling schedule and lonesome living, will it really all be worth it in the end?

episodes.summary: Furniture maker Lucinda wants to construct a beautifully crafted, two-storey, highly insulated timber home in South Herefordshire's woodland... without using heavy machinery

episodes.summary: Devoted dad Danny builds a sustainable but affordable house with bedroom pods on stilts up among the trees. But with no self-build experience and spiralling costs, can he do it on ambition alone?

episodes.summary: In the Wye Valley, Rosa and Craig battle the never-ending elements to convert a family-owned, century-old, decommissioned steam railway reservoir into a unique living space

episodes.shortSummary: Two decades on, has Sue and Martin's ancient barn renovation finally come to fruition?

episodes.title: Carmarthen, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Julie and Mark Veysey are building a Miami-style beach house on the south Devon coast
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets Julie and Mark Veysey, whose Grand Design is a stunning Miami-style beach house on a beachfront plot overlooking the south Devon coast.
episodes.title: Exmouth, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: A couple are building a split-level home cascading down a hillside in Belfast
episodes.summary: Thomas and Dervla O'Hare are building a spectacular split-level home cascading down an almost vertical hillside in Belfast. But is their vertiginous grand design a step too far?
episodes.title: Belfast, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin catches up with Ben Law to see how his woodsman's cottage has changed
episodes.summary: Kevin returns to see how Ben Law's woodsman's cottage has changed. The house has bedded down into its landscaped kitchen garden and his life has changed in unexpected ways.
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Sussex, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Pat Becker has decided to build a new home at the bottom of the garden
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets Pat Becker, who lives in a large Georgian house in Devon. But now that her family have flown the nest, she's building a new home at the bottom of the garden.
episodes.title: Devon, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Did a neighbour dispute threaten Louise and Milko's conversion of an old violin factory?
episodes.summary: Kevin catches up with Louise and Milko Ostendorf, who converted an old violin factory into a luxury home. But did a battle with their neighbours over a jointly-owned wall threatened to ruin the build?
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Waterloo 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin catches up with John and Eleni Flood, who completely gutted their Victorian terrace
episodes.summary: Kevin takes a trip back to the home of John and Eleni Flood, who completely gutted their Victorian terraced house to create an open, light and modern space
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Hackney 2005

episodes.shortSummary: John Cadney and Marnie Moon have never had a permanent home; for 16 years they've camped
episodes.summary: John Cadney is building an environmentally-friendly, four-bedroom log cabin in Kent. But how will he cope with a house imported from Finland as hundreds of pre-cut bits of wood?
episodes.title: Kent, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Jeremy and Louise try to bring their listed 16th-century farmhouse into the 21st Century
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud follows Jeremy and Louise Brown as they try to bring their Grade II Listed 16th-century Gloucestershire farmhouse into the 21st century.
episodes.title: Gloucester, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin meets Monty Ravenscroft and Clare Loewe who have bought a sliver of land in Peckham
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets Monty Ravenscroft and Clare Loewe, who can't afford to buy a house in London and have decided to build on a dirt-cheap sliver of land in Peckham.
episodes.title: Peckham, 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Have Reuben and April's attempts to transform a burnt-out stone wreck been successful?
episodes.summary: Kevin revisits Reuben and April to see if their attempts to transform a burnt-out wreck of an old stone building in Leith, with no previous building experience, has been successful
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Edinburgh 2005

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple who have spent 15 years planning their dream home
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple who have spent 15 years planning their dream home - an exotic and inspired wooden-framed house - but is the New Forest ready for such a Grand Design?
episodes.title: Dorset, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: A couple have found a plot with a view to die for on the west coast of Scotland
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud follows a couple who have found a plot with a view to die for on the west coast of Scotland. The trouble is, they are not sure what kind of house they want.
episodes.title: Glasgow, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: Will a modernist, Bauhaus-inspired white cube feel like home?
episodes.summary: Former Pet Shop Boys manager Tom Watkins and his partner Darron have spent years dreaming of building a modernist, Bauhaus-inspired white cube, but will it feel like home?
episodes.title: Hastings, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: Anjana and David Devoy plan to build a modern, minimalist home in their back garden
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets Anjana and David Devoy who, having outgrown their tiny Victorian house in Clapham, plan to build a modern, minimalist home in their back garden.
episodes.title: Clapham, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: A couple plan to buy a wreck of a stone building in Edinburgh to turn into a dream home
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple planning to buy a wreck of an old stone building in Leith, Edinburgh, to turn into their dream home, despite a total lack of building experience.
episodes.title: Edinburgh, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud follows a couple who have built houses before, but never on this scale
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud follows a couple who have built houses before, but never on this scale. Their new 'Huf Haus' is designed and made in Germany but delivered for assembly in Surrey.
episodes.title: Esher, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud visits an attempt to recreate Manhattan-loft-style living in central London
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud looks at a couple's plans to turn a crumbling, disused violin factory in central London into a Manhattan loft-style living space.
episodes.title: Waterloo, 2004

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin catches up with Denys and Marjorie at their brand new, green oak barn-style house
episodes.summary: Kevin catches up with retired couple Denys and Marjorie Randolph, who back in 1998 embarked on their final building project; a brand new, green oak barn-style house
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Oxfordshire 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin gets a shock as he revisits Anne and Richard's disused electricity substation home
episodes.summary: Kevin gets a shock as he catches up with Anne and Richard, who in the year 2000 embarked on the ambitious task of converting a disused electricity substation in Sunderland into their family home
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Sunderland 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin revisits Jeremy and Sarah, who transformed a forge into a house made of straw bales
episodes.summary: Kevin revisits the improbable build of architects Jeremy Till and Sarah Wigglesworth, who transformed a filthy old forge into a house made of straw bales, springs, nappy cladding and silver tin
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Islington 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin catches up with Rupert and Julie at their cruciform-shaped, green oak house
episodes.summary: Kevin catches up with Rupert and Julie, who were building a cruciform-shaped house made of green oak on their unadulterated plot in the Berkshire Downs. Is it the grand design they were hoping for?
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Lambourn Valley 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin travels to Hereford to meet a very young couple who are building their first home.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud travels to Hereford to meet a very young couple who are building their first home, in the centre of an ancient village, surrounded by beautiful medieval cottages.
episodes.title: Hereford, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud meets keen environmentalists Helen Gould and Phil Reddy.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets keen environmentalists Helen Gould and Phil Reddy, who are building a home in the Cumbrian countryside.
episodes.title: Cumbria, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: The Floods want to turn a cramped terraced house into a cool and roomy living space.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud joins John and Eleni Flood as they attempt to turn their cluttered and cramped Victorian terraced house in Hackney into a cool, contemporary, light and roomy living space.
episodes.title: Hackney, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: A couple have ambitious plans for their Grade Two Listed Victorian timber-clad barn.
episodes.summary: Philip and Andrea Traill have ambitious plans for their Grade II Listed Victorian timber-clad barn but their plan to combine traditional and ultra-modern design causes some headaches.
episodes.title: Surrey, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Ben Law builds a handmade, cruck-framed, self-sufficient house with no mains services
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud follows Ben Law as he attempts to build his dream home: a handmade, cruck-framed wooden house, totally self-sufficient, with no mains services
episodes.title: Sussex, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple who have their hearts set on converting a disused waterworks.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple who have their hearts set on converting a disused industrial waterworks in the Chesterfield countryside into their dream home.
episodes.title: Chesterfield, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud joins a Peterborough couple.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud joins a Peterborough couple as they seek to realise their Grand Design of a very modern home in a traditional woodland setting.
episodes.title: Peterborough, 2003

episodes.shortSummary: Did Sue and Martin realise their dream of building a home using old English techniques?
episodes.summary: Kevin travels to the beautiful setting of south Devon to revisit Sue and Martin, whose dream was to create a family home using old English building techniques
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Devon 2002

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin is in Amersham to update on a project taken on by Deborah and architect Andrew
episodes.summary: Kevin is in Amersham to update on a project taken on by Deborah and architect Andrew. Their venture involved designing an 'invisible' house that blended in with the surrounding reservoirs.
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Amersham 2002

episodes.shortSummary: Did Tony and Sharon manage to restore a dilapidated Georgian home to its former glory?
episodes.summary: Kevin revisits Tony and Sharon, who fell in love with a completely dilapidated Georgian home in London and undertook the challenging task of restoring it to its former glory
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: London 2002

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin revisits Adrian and Corrina, who bought a 300-year-old ruin for their first home
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud revisits Adrian and Corrina, who decided their first home was to be a 300-year-old ruin. The former cottage is set in the inhospitable climate of the Brecon Beacons National Park.
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Wales 2002

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin revisits an innovative housing scheme in Birmingham
episodes.summary: Kevin revisits an innovative housing scheme in Birmingham, where just over two years ago a group of 11 men and women agreed to build not just their own, but each other's homes
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Birmingham 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin catches up with self-builders Michael and Lindsay at their futuristic glass house
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud catches up with self-builders Michael Hird and Lindsay Harwood, and their futuristic glass and steel house in a suburb of Doncaster
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Doncaster 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Sue and Martin's dream is to create a family home which feels part of the earth
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud visits a couple in Devon who are hoping to convert a traditional barn complete with thatched roof.
episodes.title: Devon, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: A couple who are looking to build their hi-tech modern house in a quiet London street
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud visits a couple who are looking to build their hi-tech modern house in a quiet north London street.
episodes.title: London, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin checks out an innovative housing scheme in Birmingham
episodes.summary: Kevin checks out an innovative housing scheme set up by a Birmingham Housing Association, which allows a group of people to build their own homes
episodes.title: Birmingham, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Rupert and Julie who are taking their chances on building a very experimental home
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets a couple who plan a very expensive and very experimental design on a virgin building plot in the Lambourn Valley.
episodes.title: Lambourn Valley, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: A couple decide that their first home will be a 300-year-old ruin in the Brecon Beacon
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud travels to Wales to visit a couple who have decided that their first home will be a 300-year-old ruin in the Brecon Beacons.
episodes.title: Wales, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Chris and Jill have chosen to build their dream home by converting a deserted textile mill
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets Chris and Jill, who have chosen to build their dream home in Huddersfield by converting a deserted textile mill, which they dream of giving a light, modern interior.
episodes.title: Huddersfield, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin visits the Sussex Downs to follow the construction of a New England-style kit house
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud follows the construction of a New England style-kit house built on the Sussex Downs that was bought and designed entirely on the internet.
episodes.title: Sussex, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud meets a woman determined to build an enormous Georgian-style mansion
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud meets a woman determined to build the house of her dreams, an enormous Georgian-style mansion in Farnham, against all the odds.
episodes.title: Farnham, 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin revisits a co-operative building their own homes and those of their neighbours
episodes.summary: Kevin revisits a group of people in a Brighton co-operative who are building their own homes and the homes of their neighbours
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Brighton 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Have Jeremy and Sarah realised their dream of constructing their house with straw bales?
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud revisits Jeremy Till and Sarah Wigglesworth in Islington, London. Will they have realised their dream of using straw bales in the construction of their house?
episodes.title: Grand Designs Revisited: Islington 2001

episodes.shortSummary: Michael Hird and Lindsay Harwood are building a futuristic glass and steel house.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud travels to Doncaster where Michael Hird and Lindsay Harwood are building a futuristic glass and steel house in a suburb of Doncaster.
episodes.title: Doncaster, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Jeremy Till and Sarah Wigglesworth have an experimental design for a home/office.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud is in lslington where Jeremy Till and Sarah Wigglesworth have come up with a highly experimental design for a home/office.
episodes.title: Islington, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin travels to Cornwall to visit a couple who are trying to convert a chapel into a home
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud travels to Cornwall to visit Gavin Allen and Jane Fitzsimons, who are trying to convert a chapel into a home and a teleworking office for Jane.
episodes.title: Cornwall, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin travels to Suffolk to visit a former tax inspector who's caught the ecology bug.
episodes.summary: A Suffolk couple plan an environmentally friendly house with solar heating, grey water systems and reclaimed materials.
episodes.title: Suffolk, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud travels to Amersham where a couple plan to design an 'invisible' house.
episodes.summary: Kevin McCloud travels to Amersham, where a couple plan to design an 'invisible' house, blending in with the earth banks of the surrounding reservoirs.
episodes.title: Amersham, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin McCloud travels to Brighton to meet a co-operative of ten young families.
episodes.summary: Kevin travels to Brighton to meet a co-operative of ten young families, including ex-travellers and single parents, who are building both their own and each others homes.
episodes.title: Brighton, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin travels to Oxfordshire to meet Denys and Marjorie Randolph.
episodes.summary: Kevin travels to Oxfordshire to meet the Randolphs, who built their first house 10 years ago and now, in their 70s, have decided to do it all again!
episodes.title: Oxford, 1999

episodes.shortSummary: Kevin visits Newhaven, where Tim Cox and Julia Brock are in a race against time.
episodes.summary: A couple in Newhaven face a race against time as they build their dream home on windswept cliff-top site in time for the birth of their baby.
episodes.title: Newhaven, 1999
